event: Early Mesoamerican cultures develop in the region; Maya settlements emerge in western Honduras.
Maya city of Copán becomes a major center of the Classic Maya civilization.
Final recorded date at Copán; Maya civilization begins to decline in the area.
Christopher Columbus lands on the coast of Honduras during his fourth voyage.
Spanish conquest of Honduras begins under Gil González Dávila and Hernán Cortés.
Honduras becomes part of the Spanish Captaincy General of Guatemala.
Joins the United Provinces of Central America.
Honduras becomes fully independent after the federation dissolves.
Central American Court of Justice established in Honduras.
Military coup ousts President Ramón Villeda Morales.
Brief war with El Salvador known as the 'Football War' over immigration and land issues.
New democratic constitution enacted; civilian rule restored.
Hurricane Mitch devastates Honduras, killing thousands and causing severe economic damage.
President Manuel Zelaya is ousted in a military-backed coup; political crisis ensues.
Disputed presidential election leads to widespread protests and violence.
Honduras struggles with the COVID-19 pandemic and devastation from Hurricanes Eta and Iota.
Xiomara Castro elected as Honduras's first female president.
